meanings.definition: To place or insert spaces between (objects or elements)
meanings.sent1: She enjoys interspacing her plants in the garden to give each one enough room to grow.
meanings.sent2: The designer decided to interspace the chairs in the room to create a more open and inviting atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The kids found a fun way to play by interspacing themselves in a line, pretending to be trees in a forest.
meanings.sent4: The artist skillfully interspaced colors on the canvas, creating a beautiful and harmonious composition.
meanings.sent5: Interspacing the paragraphs in your writing can make it easier for readers to follow your ideas.

meanings.definition: The act of creating spaces between (objects or elements)
meanings.sent1: The interspacing of the chairs in the waiting room allowed for comfortable seating for all the visitors.
meanings.sent2: Proper interspacing of the seeds in the garden ensures each plant has enough space to thrive.
meanings.sent3: The interspacing of the books on the shelf made it look like a colorful and organized rainbow.
meanings.sent4: The interspacing of the buildings in the city created beautiful pockets of green spaces and parks.
meanings.sent5: The careful interspacing of the dots on the page made the text easier to read for the students.
